name: canonical-observability-solution
title: Canonical Observability Solution
summary: Highly-integrated, low-operations observability stack powered by Juju and Kubernetes.
description: The Canonical Observability Stack (COS) is a highly-integrated, low-operations observability stack powered by Juju and Kubernetes. It gathers, processes, visualizes, and alerts on telemetry generated by workloads running both within and outside of Juju environments.

use_cases.title: Enterprise Application Monitoring
use_cases.description: Organizations deploying complex enterprise applications can gain immediate visibility into system performance and health. COS automatically discovers application components through Juju topology, providing contextual monitoring that understands service relationships.

use_cases.title: Kubernetes Infrastructure Observability
use_cases.description: For teams running workloads on Kubernetes, COS provides comprehensive visibility into cluster health, resource utilization, and application performance. The tight integration with MicroK8s makes it particularly effective for monitoring Canonical Kubernetes deployments.

use_cases.title: Hybrid Infrastructure Monitoring
use_cases.description: Organizations with mixed infrastructure environments (VMs, containers, bare metal) can use COS to create a unified observability solution. Through the COS Proxy and Grafana Agent components, the stack can collect telemetry from non-Juju workloads and legacy applications.

documentation.architecture_explanation: this is an explanation of how COS works

name: canonical-5g-telco-solution
title: Canonical 5G Telco Solution
summary: A solution to deploy and operate Grafana Tempo, a distributed tracing backend that natively integrates with COS Lite, on Juju.
description:
The Canonical 5G Telco Solution provides a complete, cloud-native 5G mobile core network (Aether SD-Core) powered by Juju and Kubernetes. It enables telecommunications service providers and enterprises to deploy, manage, and scale 5G network functions following a disaggregated, microservices-based architecture with Control and User Plane Separation (CUPS).

By leveraging the topology model of Juju to manage deployment relationships, and charm relations to automate configuration and integration, it provides a low-operations 5G core with enterprise-grade reliability and security.

For Telecommunications providers and enterprises building private 5G networks, the Canonical 5G Telco Solution provides a production-ready, standards-compliant 5G core network with reduced operational complexity.

use_cases.title: Enterprise Private 5G Networks
use_cases.description: Organizations requiring dedicated, secure, and high-performance wireless connectivity can deploy private 5G networks to support critical applications. The solution provides complete control over network resources, security policies, and quality of service guarantees.

use_cases.title: 5G Core for Telecommunications Service Providers
use_cases.description: Mobile network operators can use the solution as a foundation for deploying 5G services to customers, offering modern cellular connectivity with simplified operations compared to traditional 4G/LTE networks.

use_cases.title: Edge Computing Infrastructure
use_cases.description: Organizations deploying edge computing workloads can use the 5G connectivity provided by this solution to enable reliable, high-bandwidth connections between edge nodes and central systems.

name: canonical-charmed-kubeflow
title: Charmed Kubeflow
summary: Canonical Charmed Kubeflow is a state of the art, fully supported MLOps platform that helps data scientists collaborate on AI innovation on any cloud from concept to production, offered by Canonical - the open source experts.
description:
Charmed Kubeflow (CKF) is an open-source, end-to-end, production-ready MLOps platform on top of cloud-native technologies.

It translates Machine Learning (ML) steps into complete workflows, including training, tuning, and shipping of ML models. It enables automation of workflows, increases quality of models, and simplifies deployment of ML workloads into production in a reliable way.

CKF meets the need of building ML applications in a structured and consistent manner while contributing to higher productivity and better collaboration within teams.

It is intended for data scientists and ML engineers, providing an advanced toolkit to organise and scale their work.

use_cases.title: Data Science Exploration
use_cases.description: Organizations requiring dedicated, secure environments for data exploration & model experimentation can deploy Charmed Kubeflow to provide Jupyter notebooks, data processing tools, and visualization capabilities for data scientists.

use_cases.title: ML Model Training Pipeline
use_cases.description: ML engineers can use Charmed Kubeflow as a foundation for automating model training workflows, enabling reproducible pipelines, hyperparameter tuning, and tracking of experiments with simplified operations compared to custom solutions.

use_cases.title: Production Model Deployment
use_cases.description: Organizations deploying machine learning models into production can use Charmed Kubeflow to enable reliable, scalable model serving with features like A/B testing, canary deployments, and monitoring of model performance.
